messages.title: Your local candidate
messages.content: "Just because Labour has had its running the country, some people think it's the Tories' turn again. No. It's time for a real change." "I want to see a fairer, greener and more prosperous Britain. I want our politics cleaned up with more power given back to local people."

keyPolicies.policyDescription: You will pay no tax on the first £10,000 you earn - cutting most tax bills by £700.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A fair chance for every child
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Smaller class sizes, more money into schools and abolish university tuition fees.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A fair future: create jobs by making Britain greener
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Invest in fast transport, renewable energy and energy efficient homes.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A fair deal for the politicians
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Make politicians accountable and give you the right to sack corrupt MPs.

issues.education: Smaller class sizes, more money into schools and abolish university tuition fees.
issues.environment: Invest in fast transport, renewable energy and energy efficient homes.
issues.governance: Make politicians accountable and give you the right to sack corrupt MPs.
issues.health: The Lib Dems will take action to protect vital frontline NHS services.

leaflet.personalStatement: Local girl Daisy Cooper grew up in Walberswick, attended local schools and is said to have played in the Suffolk Youth Orchestra. After achieving a Masters' Degree in Public International Law, Daisy went on to work at the Commonwealth Policy Studies Unit. At 28, Daisy is one of the UK's youngest Directors of a charitable trust - publishing an international affairs journal. Daisy is also a governor of a primary school.

images.caption: Local girl Daisy Cooper is a strong and capable voice for Suffolk Coastal.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Daisy Cooper has worked for the Commonwealth Secretariat, helping strengthen democracy and human rights in 21 countries around the world.
